problem_summary_simple: Find the last remaining person in a circle after repeatedly removing every k-th person.
problem_summary_technical: Solve the Josephus problem using either a bottom-up iterative formula or a top-down recursive approach.
key_insights: This is a classic Josephus problem. The key is to find the pattern of elimination.
The bottom-up solution uses a mathematical recurrence relation to find the winner's index.
The formula `(idx + k) % (n + 1)` effectively simulates the circular removal and re-indexing.
The recursive solution breaks down the problem from n friends to n-1 friends.
The base case is when only one friend remains.
The recursive step calculates the winner's position in the smaller circle and maps it back to the larger circle.
